article: I was on my lunch break in the city, enjoying a salad at an outdoor cafe, when a shabby homeless lady came waking towards me. She was  _  everyone who walked past her for spare  _  and she looked very dirty. My  _  reaction was fear and I hoped she wouldn't come near me, but she did.. I was on the phone and when she  came over  , I said " I'm on the phone" in the nicest way I could, telling myself what she needed was a lesson in  _  . She walked away, mumbling , " I'm  _  you. I'm sorry, I'm sorry. I'll leave." And she turned the corner.  _  ,I would feel relieved or satisfied, but something in me couldn't  _  . I got up and walked towards this lady and gave her all I  _  . She held my hand and said, " Thank you!" Her hand was  _  and dirty, but I didn't mind  _  her hand. I wanted to be there for her , when normally I would  _  the other way. She looked at me and said, "Will you touch my face?" And for some reason, I did. I put my hand on her cheek and she started to  _  I could  _  it was as if she had not been touched by a loving, soft hand in ages,  if ever  And so I held it there, trying to  _  her with my heart open. It was powerful. She thanked me and walked away quietly. And I walked away with an open heart, trying to  _  sense of what had just happened.
